title: User Management
usersenable_ipmi: Grant this user access to IPMI
password_never_expires_hint: Ignore password expiration policy for the user
redfish_auth_logging_hint: Enables Redfish sessions creation and deletion logging
users_ipmi_separatepwd: When enabled changing main password will not affect IPMI password and changing IPMI password will not affect main password. When disabled IPMI password will NOT return to be the same as main until one of them will be changed.
ipmi_separatepwd: Separate IPMI password from main password
usersenable_redfish: Grant this user access to Redfish
usersenable_webui: Grant this user access to WebUI
invalid_email_format_refer_help_content: Invalid Email ID. Refer Help content.
failureMsg: I'll try to reason out the error
usersenter_the_name_of_the_new_user_ulli:
Enter the name of the new user.
  • Name must be a string of 1 to 16 alpha-numeric characters.
  • It must start with an alphabetical character.
  • It is case-sensitive.
  • Special characters '-'(hyphen), '_'(underscore), '@'(at sign) are allowed.
usersenter_a_strong_password_including_a: Password field is mandatory and should have a minimum of 8 characters.
userssize_of_the_password: Select the preferred size for the password.
userscheck_the_box_to_enable_user_access:
Check the boxes to enable network access for the user. Upon enabling, the corresponding IPMI messaging privilege will be assigned to the user.
NOTE: It is recommended that the IPMI messaging option should be enabled as well if user is created through IPMI.
usersselect_the_privilege_level_assigned:
Select the privilege level for each channel to be assigned to this user for access to the BMC through the network interface.
There are 5 4 levels of Network Privileges (Administrator, Operator, User, OEM and None).
usersselect_the_privilege_level_to_be_as: Select the privilege level assigned to this user when the user accesses BMC through network interface. There are 5 4 levels of Network Privileges (Administrator, Operator, User , OEM and No Access).
usersthis_field_is_used_to_assign_the_kv: This checkbox is used to assign the KVM privilege for the user.
usersthis_field_is_used_to_assign_the_vm: This checkbox is used to assign the VMedia privilege for the user.
userscheck_the_box_to_enable_snmp_access: Check the box to enable SNMP access for the user.
userschoose_the_snmp_access_level_option: Choose the SNMP Access level option for this new user.
userschoose_an_authentication_protocol_f: Choose an SNMP Authentication Protocol for this user.
userschoose_the_encryption_algorithm_to_: Choose the Encryption algorithm to be used for the SNMP settings.
usersspecify_the_format_for_the_email_th:
Specify the format for the email. This format will be used, when sending emails. Two type of formats are available:
  • AMI-Format: The subject of this mail format is 'Alert from (your Hostname)'. The mail content includes sensor information, ex: Sensor type and Description.
  • FixedSubject-Format: This format displays the specific subject and message configured for email alerts for the specified user.
usersenter_the_email_id_for_the_user_if_:
Enter the email ID for the user. If user forgets the password, a new password will be mailed to this email ID.
NOTE: The SMTP Server must also be configured for this option.
Maximum allowed size for Email ID is 64 bytes (including username and domain name).
usersthe_uploaded_ssh_key_information_wi: If available, the uploaded SSH key information will be displayed (read only).
usersuse_browse_button_to_navigate_to_th:
Use Browse button to navigate to the new public SSH key file.
  • SSH key file should be of pub type.
strongSuccessMsgAndLogout: Users settings has been saved successfully. Please close this browser session and open a new browser session.
non_privilege_user_delete: You don't have permission to delete this user.
delete_confirmation_message: Click OK if you want to continue deleting this entry.
user_hlp:
The list below shows the currently configured users for each LAN channel. To Add or Edit a user, click on any available slot.
To Delete a user from the list, click its icon.
A maximum of 10 slots are available. This number includes the default admin and anonymous users.
It is advised that the anonymous user's privilege and password should be modified immediately as a security measure.
To view the page, you must have Operator privileges.
To modify or add a user, You must have Administrator privileges.
userschange_the_password: Select this option to change the password
userschange_the_ipmipassword: Select this option to change the IPMI (Short) password
Check_the_boxes_to_enable_user_access_fo: To enable or disable User Access, check or uncheck this box
access_privilege_edit_ConfirmLabel_acces: Any changes in User Access/Privilege will be reflected in the next login only and will terminate active sessions accross all the browsers. Do you want to proceed ?
access_privilege_edit_ConfirmLabel_kvm_v: Any changes in KVM/VMedia access will be reflected in the next login only and will terminate active sessions accross all the browsers. Do you want to proceed ?
access_privilege_edit_ConfirmLabel_acces: Any changes in User Access/Privilege or KVM/VMedia access will be reflected in the next login only and will terminate active sessions accross all the browsers. Do you want to proceed ?
